statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: IUPUI 91, Huntington College 81
article.story: INDIANAPOLIS (AP) -- George Hill scored 26 points and Akeem Clark had 24 to lead IUPUI to a 91-81 win over Huntington on Wednesday night. Hill made 10-of-11 shots from the field and had six rebounds and five assists for the Jaguars (1-1), who got their first win of the season after losing to Wisconsin-Green Bay on Saturday. Clark hit five 3-pointers, but IUPUI did most of its damage in the post, outscoring Huntington 48-22 in the paint. Steve Snider had 22 points and eight rebounds before fouling out and Kyle Ganton scored 19 to lead Huntington (6-4). Chase Verba and Alex Kock each scored 14 points for Huntington, which shot 55 percent for the game. But it could not overcome 24 turnovers, which led to 34 IUPUI points. The Jaguars shot 67 percent in the first half, including 6-of-10 from 3-point range, to take a 19-point lead. They also took care of the ball, committing just 11 turnovers. Four days after shooting a horrendous 33 percent from the field in the loss to Wisconsin-Green Bay, IUPUI shot 52 percent on Wednesday. Johnny Miller chipped in 16 points and six assists for IUPUI.
